resume.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to start doing something again after stopping or being interrupted
resume.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: She hopes to resume work after the baby is born.
The rebels have resumed hostilities against government troops.
He will resume training as soon as the injury is better.
resume.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if an activity or process resumes, it starts again after a pause
resume.translation[1].definitions[0].def: a short account of something such as an article or speech which gives the main points but no details
resume.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: a brief résumé of the day’s events
resume.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a short written account of your education and your previous jobs that you send to an employer when you are looking for a new job
resume.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to start to do something again after a period of rest or an interruption
resume.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: Profit-taking resumed as the yen began to lose ground.
The company said it won’t resume its efforts to sell assets until gold prices rise.
